page.title: 01INTRODUCTION - Character
page.content: The area surveyed contains a variety of landscapes. To the west is the Colne Valley and to the east the land rises 500 feet towards Bushey Heath. Two thirds of the area is open space. To the west are extensive sports fields and a golf course. To the north and east five farms, two stables, a reservoir and Elstree aerodrome form a rural landscape.Though barely 16 miles from Charing Cross the area retains a leafy, independent atmosphere. There are three jealously guarded village communities, Oxhey, Bushey and Letchmore Heath with highly valued Victorian and Edwardian terraced and villa properties. There are two large areas of dense housing of uniform architectural design built in the l950's and 1960's. There is an abundance of schools in extensive grounds.
